H0.text: The nucleus is the structure through which substances enter any plant or animal cell.

H1.text: Cell membrane is the structure through which substances enter any plant or animal cell.

H2.text: The vacuole is the structure through which substances enter any plant or animal cell.

H3.text: Chloroplast is the structure through which substances enter any plant or animal cell.

A4.text: The cell membrane thus works as a selective filter that allows only certain things to come inside or go outside the cell.

A5.text: The movement of substances across the membrane can be achieved by either passive transport, occurring without the input of cellular energy, or by active transport, requiring the cell to expend energy in transporting it.
